body:
Thanks a lot rafael. I can't understand why this patch causes failures  
in seemingly unrelated functionality... only with postgres adapter.

Apparently it ran into similar problems on master that were solved  
somehow... but solving them in 3-2 is perhaps beyond us.

If we can't get the backport in 3-2, maybe I'll prepare a gem that  
does ugly monkey patching in a 3.2 app to add this behavior in, with  
the disclaimer that the behavior causes weird tests to fail for  
reasons we can't understand -- but you need this patch if you want to  
do real concurrency in high-contention short-checkout scenarios with  
reasonable behavior.

I'm having trouble finding the output for 'the locking related one' in  
travis. If you can you give me a file and line number of the failing  
test, or the travis output excerpt of the failing test you cant'  
solve, i'll see if I can figure anything out (working on getting a  
working postgres locally so I can reproduce test failures again).


On Sep 18, 2012, at 9:14 PM, Rafael Mendonça França wrote:

> I could fix almost all the tests but the locking related I could  
> not. We need to fix it or I'll have to revert it.
>
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.
>
